abstract: DealBook Online; Lloyds Banking Group attributes profit decline in third quarter to additional 500 million pounds, or around $767 million, it set aside to compensate customers sold controversial loan insurance product.
lead_paragraph: The British bank’s results were again dragged down as it set aside $767 million to potentially compensate customers who were improperly sold so-called payment protection insurance.

headline.main: Lloyds Profit Dipped in 3rd Quarter, Weighed Down by Loan Insurance Provisions

snippet: The British bank’s results were again dragged down as it set aside $767 million to potentially compensate customers who were improperly sold so-called payment protection insurance.
